Package com.mdsol.skyfire

Class ModelAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mdsol.skyfire.ModelAccessor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    StateMachineAccessor
    public class ModelAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that provides functions to access UML models. Classes in Acceleo are used to be helpers to access the models.
    Version:
    1.0 Nov 14, 2012
    Author:
    Nan Li

      • getModelObject

        public static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EObject getModelObject​(java.lang.String path)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the EObject object of a UML model specified by path
        Parameters:
        path - a String representation of the path of a UML model
        Returns:
        an EObject object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the path to the model is not found

      • getStateMachines

        Gets all objects of StateMachine in the model
        Parameters:
        model - a UML model to parse
        Returns:
        a list of StateMachine in the model

      • createURIConverter

        protected static org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.URIConverter createURIConverter()
        Creates the URI Converter we'll use to load our modules. Take note that this should never be used out of Eclipse.
        Returns:
        The created URI Converter.
        Since:
        3.0

      • findModuleURL

        protected final java.net.URL findModuleURL​(java.lang.String moduleName)
        Clients can override this if the default behavior doesn't properly find the emtl module URL.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - Name of the module we're searching for.
        Returns:
        The template's URL. This will use Eclipse-specific behavior if possible, and use the class loader otherwise.

      • createTemplateURI

        protected final org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI createTemplateURI​(java.lang.String entry)
        Creates the URI that will be used to resolve the template that is to be launched.
        Parameters:
        entry - The path towards the template file. Could be a jar or file scheme URI, or we'll assume it represents a relative path.
        Returns:
        The actual URI from which the template file can be resolved.

      • isInWorkspace

        public static boolean isInWorkspace​(java.lang.Class<? extends org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EPackage> ePackageClass)
        Checks whether the given EPackage class is located in the workspace.
        Parameters:
        ePackageClass - The EPackage class we need to take into account.
        Returns:
        a true if the given class has been loaded from a dynamically installed bundle, false otherwise.
        Since:
        3.1
